segments.text: I see the water spilling all over the floor, and it’s making me so angry.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can the woman not notice something so obvious?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are sneaking cookies, and she’s just standing there, drying a plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is such a waste of water, and it’s going to ruin the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t stand seeing things like this—it’s so careless.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is going to fall, and the girl is going to get in trouble too.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is just a mess, and I don’t know how to feel about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman’s apron is going to get soaked, and she won’t even realize it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could step in and fix everything, but I’m just watching.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is one of those moments where everything feels like it’s falling apart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how oblivious she is to all of this.
segments.speaker: PAR
